perturbation.original_text: 4.1 Your salary will be USD370,000 per annum paid monthly in arrears on or about the last working day of each month (less statutory and voluntary deductions) ("Salary"). Salary will be converted to GBP and paid in GBP based on the USD/GBP Bank of England daily spot exchange rate applicable on the date of this Agreement, with the exchange rate being revised according to the prevailing Bank of England daily spot exchange rate applicable on 1 January of each year. Your Salary will be reviewed annually in accordance with the Company's practices from time to time (which is expected to be by the end of the first quarter of each year). You will be notified in writing of any changes to your Salary or benefits.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1 Your compensation will be USD370,000 per annum paid monthly in arrears on or about the last working day of each month (less statutory and voluntary deductions) ("Salary"). Compensation will be converted to GBP and paid in GBP based on the USD/GBP Bank of England daily spot exchange rate applicable on the date of this Agreement, with the exchange rate being revised according to the prevailing Bank of England daily spot exchange rate applicable on 1 January of each year. Your Salary will be reviewed annually in accordance with the Company's practices from time to time (which is expected to be by the end of the first quarter of each year). You will be notified in writing of any changes to your Salary or benefits.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Salary' is defined but then 'compensation' is used interchangably. Because compensation has a broader meaning than salary, this makes the definition unclear. If salary is specifically 370,000, is compensation just that or other aspects of employment as well?

perturbation.original_text: 12.1 A copy of the Company's disciplinary, dismissal and grievance procedures are set out in its employee handbook (the "Employee Handbook").
perturbation.changed_text: 12.1 A copy of the Company's disciplinary, dismissal and grievance procedures are set out in its personnel guidelines (the "Employee Handbook").
perturbation.explanation: The clause refers to 'Employee Handbook' but then introduces 'personnel guidelines' which is not consistent with the original document. This creates confusion about which document governs disciplinary procedures.
